utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: So, uh, what did you want?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Too late for what?

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: I'll tell you later.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Come on, the bell just rang. We still got time.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: I'm ready.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Why now, all of a sudden?

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: What, you don't want to anymore?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. I'm just wondering what changed your mind.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Now?

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: If you want.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: But we didn't—

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: We weren't doing anything.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Ms. Washburn, please, if I get one more referral, my mom—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who put sand in her vagina?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, kids. How you boys doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I certainly hope so. You know what this is?

utterance.speaker: Boy 1
utterance.content: A laptop?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Password-protected laptop that I need you nerds to hack into.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No insecticides or toxic cleaners.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Check the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Boy 1
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your roommate's doctor. You remember your roommate, don't you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's what the morons at the Rutgers Student Medical Center thought, which may be part of the reason he just coughed up a lung.

utterance.speaker: Boy 1
utterance.content: What do you mean, he coughed up a lung?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He coughed… after which the respiratory organ which resided in his chest resided in his mouth… Actually, his hand. Well, his mouth, then his hand.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Bathroom's clean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's in this?

utterance.speaker: Boy 1
utterance.content: Just soda.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mind if I have some?

utterance.speaker: Boy 1
utterance.content: You want my drink?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got a problem with that?

utterance.speaker: Boy 2
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Actually, I do. You barge into our room, start looking through our personal, private stuff, demand I hack into a computer I think I can safely assume doesn't belong—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry. Did I break your concentration? Please continue. You were talking about personal privacy. What, you're finished? Well, allow me to retort.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting theory. Can you prove it?

utterance.speaker: Timmy
utterance.content: Doctors don't carry guns. They don't shoot people, and they definitely don't search patients' homes. Plus, I've seen Pulp Fiction — the movie you're totally ripping off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Wait, uh, was it Timmy Morgan?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: It had to be him. He's, like, totally obsessed with old movies.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: So you're here to talk to the principal about something Timmy did?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got no problem with Timmy. And even if I did, I ain't no snitch.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Then why are you here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To dig myself out of a hole. Instead I dug a bigger one.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: What'd you do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What'd you do?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: What'd you do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What happened to your eye?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: It's none of your business.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, it's none of yours. I'm a doctor. It's a few days old, so that's not why you're here, unless you two got busted for some sort of revenge plot. But then you'd look angry instead of… ashamed.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: I'm not ashamed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting. You defensively insist that you're not ashamed, which, of course, means you are ashamed. And yet, you're the victim.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: You want to know how she got the black eye? Tell us why you're here first.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anyone ever tell you you're annoying?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't kill anybody. I have to be here, so I figured I'd punch up the stakes in the first act. But we did, and almost always do, search the patient's home. And if we tell them first, then they can hide something that we need to know in order to figure out what's wrong with them.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Why would they hide something that could be killing them?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because they are morons. They're all morons, and everybody lies.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: Wait, if everybody lies, then that means you're lying right now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't say everybody always lies… Aristotle. And on that note, unless there are any questions… Good.

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Oh, Dr. Hourani… before you finish, maybe you could describe what you actually do. You know, like if someone comes in for a routine physical?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want routine?

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: It just feels kind of, like, numb.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You do a lot of bicycle riding?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How long have you been married?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: It's 12 years next month.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have six kids.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Well, you don't think it could have anything to do with that, do you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably. How often do you use your vibrator?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your battery-operated Brad Pitt. After giving the gift of life to six eight-pound, four-ounce wrecking balls, I think I can safely assume it's an industrial-strength model?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You wanted routine. Am I done?

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Maybe we should just move on.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: I meant with your typical day. I assume you see more than one patient?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Okay. Then I guess we will move on to our next guest.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: Wait, if you only see one patient, what do you do the rest of the day?

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Dr. Hourani?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just in time for lunch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I meant sex… Fine. Lunch. How about we start with a small tossed salad?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: As of this morning, I'm on a diet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Meaning?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you told me you were supposed to be busy 20 minutes ago. But you were obviously able to put them off then, there's no reason you can't put them off now.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How about, "I wanted to then, and now I don't"?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Get your finger off my phone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We obviously have something we need to discuss.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Now is not a good time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you're mad because you don't feel you're getting the necessary amount of “affection,” all you have to do is ask.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If memory serves, I enjoyed a healthy Sunday brunch. So your insinuation—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ow! What is your problem?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So that's what a typical doctor does on a typical day. Any questions?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: What's a vibrator?

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Why was your girlfriend so mad?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It doesn't matter.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Well, obviously it matters. I mean, if she's your girlfriend, you should care how she feels.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I mean, it doesn't matter to the story.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: It's the most important part of the story. It's the only thing that does matter. You don't kiss her enough — is that the problem?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely not.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Which, by your definition, means it is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We kiss plenty. Your turn.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Then what's the problem?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your turn.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: What's the problem?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Excuse me. When exactly will the commandant be back?

utterance.speaker: Receptionist
utterance.content: Shouldn't be much longer, sir.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Oh, so now you're not gonna talk. That's real mature.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: All right, fine. We got busted for kissing behind the school. Now you know why we're here. So tell us why you're here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The deal was about the black eye.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: And we didn't kiss.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you were just making him beg, huh? I didn't have you pegged as a tease.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: I'm not a tease.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The available evidence suggests otherwise.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: I'm not a tease.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Prove it… By–by telling me your story.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: You're a pathetic loser, jerk! And I wouldn't kiss you if I had brain cancer and your lips were the cure!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She actually said that?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Well, yeah, that was, like, two days ago.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: It doesn't matter. I clearly didn't lead him along or anything like that, which proves I'm not a tease. So why is your girlfriend mad at you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm getting a kind of bossy vibe. I take it you're into that.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Don't answer! Your turn.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What seems to be the problem, sir?

utterance.speaker: Phillip
utterance.content: I'm having more difficulty breathing and some pain in my chest.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're new, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I just moved from Chicago.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Chicago's awesome. What part are you from?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We need to get a chest C.T.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Excuse me, I'm the senior team member, which means we don't need anything unless I say we need it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Do you want to have an affair?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want to have a threesome?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You can't talk to her like that. I'm telling Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need a chest C.T.

utterance.speaker: Taub and Chase
utterance.content: Get it yourself.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Isn't that, like, sexual harassment?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not if you're good-looking.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: You said the one guy was short with a big nose.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Guess that's not the only thing that's big.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: It means he's lying… again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you can't handle the truth!

utterance.speaker: Timmy
utterance.content: That's so easy. A Few Good Men.

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Okay, I give up. I think we should move on to our next guest. Mr. Dryden… uh, works for one of the largest advertising agencies in New York City.

utterance.speaker: Kids
utterance.content: Boring! Boring!

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Can we at least hear what happened to the patient?

utterance.speaker: Kids
utterance.content: Yeah! Please…

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: If Dr. Hourani promises to—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Patient's dead. Floor is yours, Don.

utterance.speaker: Dryden
utterance.content: Dave.

utterance.speaker: Timmy
utterance.content: He's not dead. You said earlier he was still in the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: What's wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's got a cough.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: You said he coughed up a lung.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: What about the laptop?

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Who cares about the laptop?

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: Yeah, and he already said he was lying about that, you moron.

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Gabe… we do not use that word here.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: He did.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, and I was talking about people like you.

utterance.speaker: Kids
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Dr. Hourani, please, could you just finish, quickly, so we can move on?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: I don't know what's wrong. He was stable for a while, and then all of a sudden, he just—

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Bronchial infection must be from a drug-resistant strain.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: O-2 sats are plummeting.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We need to get him on a bronchodilator before he goes into respiratory arrest.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Suction, sit him up.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Start blow by oxygen.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I think it's his… It's his lung.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: That actually happened?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, it really happened. I take cases that other doctors fail to diagnose, which is why I only take one at a time. My current patient is a college student. He's actually in the hospital right now. And, yes, he really did cough up a large portion of dead lung tissue.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: How's that even possible?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: How's that even possible?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Primary squamous carcinoma could cause lung tissue to basically disintegrate.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not cancer. F.O.B. was normal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not an infection either. Broad-spectrum antibiotics haven't had any effect.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who password-protects a computer they keep in a locked desk in a locked office?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Someone who works with someone who thinks it's okay to break into other people's homes?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: An amebic liver abscess could rupture through the diaphragm into the thorax.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not when his liver-function tests are all normal.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: His dorm mates are computer science majors. If they're fabricating chips, they could be working with all kinds of different toxic solvents.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We need to search the dorm.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: "We"?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oui. Allons-y. While we're out, do a thoracoscopic lung biopsy and a c-ANCA, because it's sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But if you think it's sarcoidosis, why are you…

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: So you really did force his roommate to hack into the laptop?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why would I lie?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: But whose laptop is it?

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: It's your girlfriend's, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's not my girlfriend. I'm just interested in her because she's a client, and she sleeps above her covers — four feet above her covers.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Timmy
utterance.content: Ghostbusters.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: So that's why she's so mad — you looked through her computer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, that part happened after she got mad. First she got mad. Then I stole her computer to fix things. And then we got the case.

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Wait, so you tried to fix your relationship by stealing her computer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, when you say it like that… Yes.

utterance.speaker: Female lawyer
utterance.content: Looks like you're the moron.

utterance.speaker: Kids
utterance.content: Ooh!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I can also get three sets of golf clubs in there.

utterance.speaker: Timmy
utterance.content: No way. You didn't get her laptop by blowing down the door of her office. That's from Thunderbolt and Lightfoot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just seeing if you're still paying attention. It was actually more subtle.

utterance.speaker: Timmy
utterance.content: The Thomas Crown Affair — the Steve McQueen version.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Just tell us the truth already.

utterance.speaker: Dryden
utterance.content: Excuse me. But there are others here who would like a chance to speak.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go right ahead.

utterance.speaker: Kids
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Audience is always right.

utterance.speaker: Luke
utterance.content: It wasn't me.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Ma'am, are you okay? Can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: Mother
utterance.content: Ooh, what's that smell?

utterance.speaker: Patients
utterance.content: Ugh.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Call Dr. Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Female lawyer
utterance.content: You poisoned a room full of patients so you could steal your girlfriend's laptop?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't poison anybody. I spilled some hydrogen sulfide and ammonia on the floor, thinking the stench would clear the place out. But instead of breathing through his nose, some idiot decided to hold his breath. He passes out, and before I know it, the place is a perfect storm of mass hysteria… Although it worked out just as well.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: They're morons.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Agreed.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: No, not the patients, the kids. It doesn't matter how you stole it. What matters is why.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, you're starting to remind me of someone.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I didn't ask how you stole it. I asked why.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Isn't it obvious?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You think you can tell why she's mad by reading budget spreadsheets and per diem schedules?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know why she's mad. What I need to know is how to make her un-mad. And step one is gaining access to the journal on her laptop, where she records her innermost thoughts… Instead of just watching porn with me. Oh, grow up. If porn was bad, why would there be so many nuns in it?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why is she mad?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was myself, which, by the way, she's supposed to love unconditionally. I didn't do anything! We had a great weekend. Went to a blues club, we watched Cinderfella on DVD.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It doesn't matter. She's being unreasonable, and I have to fix it. I need to know what's really important to her. I need something big.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Because?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're past that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Have you tried childhood pet names?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know her pets.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She's never mentioned a pet?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, yeah, but I wasn't listening. She's not mad because I don't remember a dead dog's name.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Her first dog was Ronaldo.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I didn't ask. Try both.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Just got a case from the E.R. Rutgers student came in with what looked like acute bronchitis. But there's nothing in his blood or sputum cultures.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't you think it's time you people stop looking to the white man to solve all your problems?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His O-2 sats are in the toilet. If we don't figure out what's attacking his—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So figure it out! I'm busy.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: That can't be true.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: 'Cause if he was dying — I mean, you're a doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Patients die every day. Not all of them are interesting.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: You still haven't answered either question.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She was mad because she's genetically programmed to make a big deal out of every little thing.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: So she's mad 'cause she's a girl.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Actually, she's not like that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why are you sticking up for her? She says you're a pathetic jerk and she hates you.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: That was a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: It was two days ago.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: And it wasn't even true then.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Because I know how you think.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey. Uh, and no peck on the cheek. It has to be on the lips.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Winning a bet to force her to kiss you actually cuts against your theory that you know how she thinks.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I wasn't forcing her to do anything that she didn't want to do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're hoping for a career in the NBA or the NFL?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: The bet let her do what she wanted to do while still being able to act like she didn't, so her friends wouldn't get all, like, calling her a slut or something. Not that it's slutty or anything. It's just a kiss.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Not even close to true. I just couldn't believe I'd lose.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah, now we're getting somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: No, we're not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, I thought we were.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: No, you thought we weren't, and that's exactly what you want, because you don't want to tell us why was she mad at you! You tell us you don't want to do your job because you're too busy trying to break into your girlfriend's laptop to figure out a way to make her not mad at you. But you don't tell us why she was mad at you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's stupid.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Talk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm out of here. Unless…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you never know.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yes, I do. Can you take the garbage out before you go?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, I-I-I would, but…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, come on. It's not a lot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pain's always worst first thing in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mommy!

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: You used her toothbrush?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: That's so gross.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's the big deal? It's not like she had a problem swapping spit the night before.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Well, maybe it's not the swapping spit that bothers her, but the fact that you don't listen to her. Had she warned you not to do it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, I listen to her.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: But you just said before that you didn't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I said I didn't remember what she said.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: No, you said you don't listen—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I listen to her. Okay? Believe me, I listen.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's my toothbrush, and it's not just once. And it's not like I'd even care, but you totally destroy it. You're supposed to brush with it, not gnaw on it like a rawhide bone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think Miss Four Cavities' time would be better spent copying Mr. No Cavities instead of complaining about him. And given what I'd just been doing, I thought you wouldn't want me going out to dinner without a good brush and a floss.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Would you please just use the toothbrush I bought you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Would you please just shut up and watch the movie? I said, "please."

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Why would you have to brush your teeth before you go to dinner?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't want to know… yet.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: You're gross and dumb. You listen to what she says just so you can tell her how wrong she is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You are clueless and naive. I have to tell her that she's wrong, 'cause no one else will. She's the boss, which means she's surrounded by morons who are either afraid of her, or they want to kiss up to her, or they want to… kiss her.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: But not you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I already kissed her. And I respect her enough not to treat her like some tender blossom who needs to be coddled.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Makes sense to me.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: That's what you think you did?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Yeah, totally.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: No, I didn't punch her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're a moron.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I didn't mean to. The stick had wicked heel curve.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did I mention you're a moron?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Okay, you just said it's wrong to treat your girlfriend like she's weaker than you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not talking about trying to score. I'm talking about shooting high. Tennis shoes on a wooden floor? She obviously can't butterfly and cover the low corners.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Your turn. The laptop.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: I must be in the midst of a complex partial seizure, 'cause I know you are not sitting at my desk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. Ran out of lotion in mine.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: Get the hell out of here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can't. This is the only place left that Cuddy'll never look for me. And I still haven't found what I'm looking for.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: Well, I can tell you, what you're about to find is my foot in your ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't think we've got enough lotion for that.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: How did you even get in here? The door was locked.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, either I can walk through walls, or… We have liftoff.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: Is that Cuddy's journal?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it's a freelance piece I'm writing for Teen Vogue.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: No, no, no. Let me see that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, got to go.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: Key.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got to give you one thing, Hourani. Your wife — she's beautiful. I mean, wow.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: Thank you. House!

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Wait. I thought you were Dr. Hourani.

utterance.speaker: Kids
utterance.content: Yeah, who are you?

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: So that's why you're here? Well, that was stupid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. Mr. Stupid-Head at your service.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: In the principal's office.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. Means the treatment's already working.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It would if we'd actually started the treatment, but we didn't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why the hell not?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Because it's not sarcoidosis. If you were here, you would know that. He's dying. What's left of his lung is collapsing. F.N.A. of the mediastinal—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't care about the F.N.A. What I care about is how he responds to the treatment.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just do it. Sarcoidosis… is a diagnosis of exclusion, which means that the cowards who spend their time excluding what it isn't usually cause their patients to die from what it is.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I don't get it. Why would you lie about your name?

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Well, who cares? What did she write in her journal?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you. That is exactly my point. Why does no one ever believe me?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just because he's dying doesn't make it interesting.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: You cheated on her, didn't you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I didn't cheat on her.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: It's obviously more than just you used her toothbrush and wouldn't take the garbage out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, actually, it was exactly that.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I just need some time alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because I used your toothbrush?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And you wouldn't take out the garbage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's insane. You know that, right?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You do whatever you want, always.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said I was sorry. I was — I was still half asleep. I wasn't paying attention.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And you're always right. And I don't mean you always think you're right. But y-you are actually always right, because that's all that matters.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That doesn't even make sense. What, you want me to be wrong?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I want you to care about more than just what you want, what you think. You need me, House. And you may even love me. But you don't care about me. And I deserve someone who does.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: That's what I said. You don't listen to her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You didn't say that.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Yes, I did.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I wasn't listening, then.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: But you found a way to fix things, right? That's why you were happy when you read her laptop.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I did. At least I thought I did.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She recently got the thin envelope from her first choice preschool. But it turns out it was her fake first choice, 'cause she was convinced she couldn't get her kid into her actual first choice without a substantial donation or an inside connection.

utterance.speaker: Wells
utterance.content: If it's Brye Park, I'm afraid she's right.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Wait, that's our school.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: What other school would he be talking about? Just finish the story.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, I got to tell you — there is bossy, which can be sexy. And then there's bitchy—

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Finish the story.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You obviously know this because you're on the school board, which puts you on the inside, and being the CEO here obviously connects you with Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Wells
utterance.content: Well, if we're so connected, why isn't she the one asking?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because she thinks it's wrong to use connections to cut in line. I don't.

utterance.speaker: Wells
utterance.content: I might be able to help.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fantastic.

utterance.speaker: Wells
utterance.content: But I could use a favor as well.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I needed to take care of something.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not a foreign body.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You must have missed it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If we do any more imaging, we're gonna have to add radiation poisoning to the DDX.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I meant the sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The biopsy and c-ANCA were both negative.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're gonna have to do a pneumonectomy .

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No sign of drug or alcohol abuse. He's not a smoker, a coal miner, or a potter — it's sarcoidosis. Start him on corticosteroids and methotrexate.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If it's a drug-resistant bug, and we give him steroids—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He'll die, which from the sound of it wouldn't be much worse. You moron.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: But you have to show him your I.D. And your insurance stuff. You can't just give him a fake name.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't have to do anything. Last time I checked, this was still America. Of course, that was ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: But you're gonna pay him, right? I mean, it was your fault.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A yellow light does not mean stop. It was, at the most, 20% my fault. Since insurance companies automatically put 100% of the fault on the rear-ender, my little lie was actually an effort to achieve an outcome closer to the truth. And it would have worked, too, if it weren't for those meddling kids.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am Dr. Hourani.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Then why did you say the other doctor was Hourani?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's, uh — it's a common name. It's like Smith… in Lebanon.

utterance.speaker: Dryden
utterance.content: Let me see your I.D.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I told you, I left it in my other pants.

utterance.speaker: Dryden
utterance.content: Really? 'Cause it looks like it's still in this pair.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get your hands off me.

utterance.speaker: Dryden
utterance.content: Give me your I.D.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, would you stop that?

utterance.speaker: Dryden
utterance.content: Give me your I.D.

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Gentlemen, please.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What? What?

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Kids, stay calm.

utterance.speaker: Dryden
utterance.content: Gimme your I.D.!

utterance.speaker: Corwin
utterance.content: Stop this right now! Stay in your seats, kids. Stay calm, you guys. Stay in your seats. Gentlemen, please. This is not the time or place.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Why don't you just take off? It's not like the principal can call your parents.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: No, but the principal can call the police or the guy he's doing the favor for.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: His girlfriend's obviously gonna find out. He's screwed. I'd bolt.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: No, you wouldn't.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Yeah, I would.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: No, you wouldn't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I guess… I don't want to do it like this. Sorry for shooting the puck so hard and tricking you in the bet.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: You didn't trick me.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Yeah, I did. I gave Madison a Red Dead Revolver cheat code so she'd hit your foot with the rope.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: You're right. It's just… I really like you. And I'm pretty sure you like me too. But I don't want to play any more games. When you want — I mean, if you ever want to, just tell me you're ready, and, you know… Sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well done.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: He's not always a jerk. And neither are you. She obviously likes you. Just stop using her toothbrush and stop playing games. She'll still like you.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: She's bossy… but she's usually right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is there a third option?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can call the police. You can turn me in for lying at the accident.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let her daughter in. She's a great kid, and Dr. Cuddy is a great mom. They'll fit in perfectly here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know. I just know that I need to do something. I need her in my life. You know what it's like to actually need someone?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can I be excused?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's just food. Something small enough to go down the wrong pipe, too big to get washed out by the bronchial lavage.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Wouldn't show up on a C.T.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But would cause the C.O.P.D. And wouldn't respond to steroids or antibiotics. Prep him for exploratory surgery and start the betting.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Betting?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got a hundred bucks says it's a pea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. I just want to say that I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Shouldn't you be saying that to Sanford Wells? A fifth-grade career day? You really thought you could pull that off?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I figured, how hard could it be? And I wanted to prove to you that I do care about your needs and Rachel's. I do.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Is that why you also stole my computer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, it is.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And then threw it in the trash?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I did not throw it, I placed it, knowing that the janitor would find it and know it was yours and return it to you unharmed. I'm a moron. But that doesn't mean I-I don't care about you, that I don't think about you, that I don't want you to be happy. I was wrong. You were right. I can do better. Just… give me a chance.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So what were you — an Astronaut or a Bullfighter?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was myself… for the most part. I know you're still upset, so I'm gonna… I'll leave you to — to deal with it however you want.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House. You want to come over for dinner tonight?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'd love to.
